XmlWorldData.name: Maze Tutorial 1
XmlWorldData.description: Kodu Maze Tutorial, part 1, created for the 2014 Hour of Code. Visit https://www.youtube.com/user/KoduTeam for a video walk-through of this tutorial.
XmlWorldData.creator: KoduTeam

Step.GamepadText:
Welcome to Maze Tutorial 1!
Bro-du<filter.blue><kodu> is LOST in the maze and it's up to Kodu<filter.white><kodu> to rescue him! To find the entrance and exit of the maze look for <filter.castle><filter.castle> Once you find Bro-du<filter.blue><kodu> lead him home<filter.hut>!

Step.GamepadText:
Before we can rescue Bro-du<filter.blue><kodu> we'll need to learn a few things first.
Today we will be programming: (1) Kodu<filter.white><kodu> to move as a result of input. (2) Bro-du<filter.blue><kodu> to follow Kodu<filter.blue><kodu> once he has been found in the maze.
Let's get started!

Step.GamepadText: On the third row move the pencil cursor to the plus sign next to WHEN then press <a> to add <sensor.keyboard>
Step.MouseText: On the third row click on the plus sign next to WHEN and select <sensor.keyboard>
Step.TouchText: On the third row click on the plus sign next to WHEN and select <sensor.keyboard>

Step.GamepadText: On the plus sign next to the <sensor.keyboard> press <a> to add <filter.arrowkeys>
Step.MouseText: Click On the plus sign next to the keyboard <sensor.keyboard> and select <filter.arrowkeys>
Step.TouchText: Click On the plus sign next to the keyboard <sensor.keyboard> and select <filter.arrowkeys>

Step.GamepadText: Now move the pencil cursor to the right of DO on the first row and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have when <sensor.keyboard> <filter.arrowkeys> do <actuator.movement>
Step.MouseText: Now click on the plus sign to the right of DO and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have when <sensor.keyboard> <filter.arrowkeys> do <actuator.movement>
Step.TouchText: Now click on the plus sign to the right of DO and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have when <sensor.keyboard> <filter.arrowkeys> do <actuator.movement>

Step.Comment: Pause when done with the programming.

Step.GamepadText: Hey you're done! Now that you've programmed Kodu it's time to run the game again and see your work in action.

Step.GamepadText: Use the left stick <leftstick> to move Kodu.
Step.TouchText: Tap the screen where you want Kodu to go!.

Step.GamepadText:
Nice Moves!
The next step is program Bro-du to follow Kodu out of the Maze. Bro-du is the blue Kodu object<filter.blue><kodu>in the center of the maze.

Step.GamepadText: When ready program in row 1 When <sensor.eyes><kodu>

Step.GamepadText: Let's get more specific. Click on the Plus sign next to the Kodu and click colors and then <filter.white> When done you should have when <sensor.eyes><kodu><filter.white>

Step.GamepadText: Let's add one last filter: Press the plus next to <filter.white>, click on <group.options>, then click on <filter.lineofsight>

Step.TouchText: Let's add one last filter: Press the plus next to <filter.white>, click on <group.options>, then click on <filter.lineofsight>

Step.GamepadText: Click the plus next to Do and add <actuator.movement> <selector.towardclosest> When done you should have when <sensor.eyes><kodu><filter.white> <filter.lineofsight> DO <actuator.movement> <selector.towardclosest>

Step.GamepadText:
After playing the maze can you try:
1) Programming other ways to control <kodu>, like making him <actuator.jump> using the Space Key. 2) Programming <kodu> to move <modifier.quickly> by adding a Modifier Tile after the <actuator.movement>?
